newsitem.title: CANADA: Certicom in pact with Motorola for stock, products.
newsitem.headline: Certicom in pact with Motorola for stock, products.

text.p: Certicom Corp., a provider of cryptographic technologies and information security products, said Friday Motorola Corp. has purchased stock and warrants, which if exercised would give it 10 percent of the company.
In a joint statement, Motorola said it purchased 500,000 Certicom common shares at $27 per share, for about C$13.5 million ($9.8 million).

In addition, Certicom has granted Motorola warrants for up to 500,000 additional common shares at prices up to $32.40 each over the next two years. Should all warrants be exercised, Motorola would then hold about 10 percent of Certicom.
In a joint announcement, Certicom also said a Motorola representative has been appointed to Certicom's board of directors, effective immediately.
Certicom's core technology is the Certicom Elliptic Curve Engine (CE)2 - which performs encryption and other services required for advanced data security.

As part of the agreement, Motorola said it will use Certicom's products in its wireless, integrated circuit and systems technologies. Motorola, based in Schaumburg, Ill, provides wireless communications, semiconductors, and advanced electronic systems, components, and services.
